column4: Alright, I can't seem to find an answer to this at all. After updating to Feisty, I haven't been able to send emails through SMTP. Either using Evolution or Thunderbird
using what as your smtp server ?
you didn't answer my question - exim locally? your isp's smarthost, or what ?
ok; upgrading to feisty shouldnt break that unless you configured some kind of firewall. Try ecks solution
My websites and a free POP
what have websites got to do with SMTP ?
telnet SMTPHOST 25
and then type in:     EHLO foo.bar
oh come on, think .. ?
telnet smtp.myisp.com 25
note the space between the hostname and 25
if it connects you should get a line back from the server which starts with 220 - eg I get  "220 asmtp-out1.blueyonder.co.uk ESMTP Thu, 26 Apr 2007 22:37:34 +0100"
I'm not getting anything. It's still trying...
Telnet isn't getting a response
and you put the " 25" on the end ?
what do you get with iptables -L ?
telnet mail.gamecootie.com 25
Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)
ok, so nothing wrong there then. I can connect to that server on port 25 from here, so I'm at a loss as to why you cannot connect
can you connect to smtp.blueyonder.co.uk ?
ah I see
No
